title: Kenya: Raila to Sue Duale Over Sh40m Mumias Sugar Debt Remarks
text:
Ethiopia: ICT Development Towards Trade 
"The words are also understood to mean that our client pursues a deliberate political strategy to impoverish the people of Kenya," Raila's lawyer Paul Mwangi said in a letter. 
Mwangi said Duale's "derogating language was malicious, insulting and meant to accentuate the harm and injury inflicted to Raila". 
This comes after Duale poked Raila over the Kenya - Uganda sugar deal, saying "after being cagey and evasive, Raila has confessed that he owes the poor sugar cane farmers what he casually and callously terms a commercial loan". 
He said Raila was deceiving farmers by portraying himself as a defender of their rights yet he had a role in the sugar industry's woes. 
Duale said DP William Ruto, who was Minister of Agriculture at the time, took bold steps to end smuggling by sugar cartels, which "affected Raila's personal interests". Kenya
